thread.title: Crawlin' Crab running events, Apprentice football game among weather-related postponements
thread.title_full: Crawlin' Crab running events, Apprentice football game among weather-related postponements

title: Crawlin' Crab running events, Apprentice football game among weather-related postponements
text:
Crawlin' Crab running events, Apprentice football game among weather-related postponements Daily Press 
The bad weather and a forecast for more prompted some changes in plans. 
Running: 
The Crawlin’ Crab Sports and Fitness Expo, Half Marathon, 5K, Kids Kilometer and Craft Brew Fest, set for Friday through Sunday in Hampton, was postponed. Event organizers are considering rescheduling it instead of canceling the activities. 
Tennis: 
The Back Creek Open, a Peninsula Tennis Patrons Association event set for York County this weekend, was canceled. 
COLLEGES: 
Football: 
Apprentice School’s game against Fork Union Military Academy, scheduled for 4 p.m. Saturday in Newport News, was rescheduled for 1 p.m. Oct. 31 at Apprentice Field. 
Women’s soccer: 
Kailyn Slade had three goals as VCU (3-6-1) won its Atlantic 10 opener by defeating host Davidson 4-2. 
Slade scored on a breakaway in the 58th minute to break a tie, then made it 4-2 in the 68th. ... 
Old Dominion's home game against Middle Tennessee State, scheduled for Friday, was postponed because of weather. The makeup day is to be determined. 
Also postponed indefinitely was William and Mary's CAA game at Elon, which was planned for Friday. 
Men’s basketball: 
Virginia, expected to be one of the highest-ranked teams in the nation, announced it would hold an intrasquad scrimmage Oct. 24. 
The time will be announced after the kickoff time is determined for the Cavaliers’ home football game against North Carolina that day.
